alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 5:06AM MST until April 03 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR A DAM RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release along the Salt River continue * WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following county, Maricopa. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...lowland flooding along the Salt River between Stewart Mountain Dam and Granite Reef Dam. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 504 AM MST, Water releases from Roosevelt Dam have necessitated steady releases from Stewart Mountain Dam. Strong currents, increased water levels, and cold water temperatures will persist resulting in dangerous conditions for recreation along the Salt River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blue Point, Pebble Beach, and Salt River Tubing Recreation Areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away! Strong currents can be dangerous for kayakers.
